question: How does a solar eclipse affect solar energy production, and can you generate a code snippet to simulate this effect?
true_answer: A solar eclipse can temporarily reduce solar energy production by blocking sunlight. A code snippet to simulate this effect has been generated.

steps.content: How does a solar eclipse affect solar energy production, and can you generate a code snippet to simulate this effect?

Plan: 1) Search for the effect of solar eclipses on solar energy production. 2) Generate a code snippet to simulate solar energy reduction during an eclipse. 3) Combine the information and return the answer.
Searching for the effect of solar eclipses on solar energy production.
A solar eclipse can significantly reduce solar energy production as the moon blocks sunlight from reaching solar panels.
Generating a code snippet to simulate the effect of a solar eclipse on solar energy production.
Code snippet generated to simulate solar energy reduction during a solar eclipse.
Can you provide some insights on how often solar eclipses occur?
Plan: 1) Search for the frequency of solar eclipses. 2) Return the answer.
Searching for the frequency of solar eclipses.
Solar eclipses occur roughly every 18 months somewhere on Earth.
